intro: Microstylis corymbosa, commonly known as the clustered spikegrass, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense clusters of small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Its botanical features include narrow, grass-like leaves and tiny, wind-pollinated flowers that produce small, dry seeds. Microstylis corymbosa is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
